channel.title: CVE Feed for Brave -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Brave -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-21323|2024-08-03T18:09:15.370Z -- brave -- brave-browser
item.description: Brave is an open source web browser with a focus on privacy and security. In Brave versions 1.17.73-1.20.103, the CNAME adblocking feature added in Brave 1.17.73 accidentally initiated DNS requests that bypassed the Brave Tor proxy. Users with adblocking enabled would leak DNS requests from Tor windows to their DNS provider. (DNS requests that were not initiated by CNAME adblocking would go through Tor as expected.) This is fixed in Brave version 1.20.108

item.title: CVE-2024-35655|2024-08-02T03:14:53.667Z -- brave -- brave%20popup%20builder
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Brave Brave Popup Builder allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Brave Popup Builder: from n/a through 0.6.9.
